person:biography.personal-details:content:
Dr Ian Johnston is an Associate Professor of Research in the School of Engineering and Computer Science at the University of Hertfordshire.
My research related roles include: Head of the Bioengineering Research Group. Interim Head of the Microfluidics & Microengineering Research Group. Member of the Centre for Research in Biodetection Technologies. Member of the Extracellular Vesicle Research Unit.
I am a research Engineer who specialises in exploitation of microfluidic techniques for advancement of biodetection technologies. Current biodetection application areas include biowarfare, food security, healthcare monitoring, aquaculture and environmental monitoring, crop protection, woodland & plant biosecurity. My academic interests lie in exploring the boundaries between and integration of engineering, physical sciences and biology to develop new approaches and solutions for real world challenges.
My research focuses on academic and industrial experimental research into microfluidic lab-on-a-chip devices and integrated systems for both laboratory prototype and in-field Biodetection applications. Areas of expertise include droplet microfluidics, EWOD, microfluidic magnetic separation, biological sample processing and microfluidic flow control including micropumping and micromixing.
